skillTree.localised_description: The Sciortini, which roughly translates to “watchmen” or “sentinel”, is a gift given to Lorenzo by his youngest son, Giordano. This flintlock pistol was Giordano’s weapon during his early days under the service of the famous Tilean pirate, Captain Luka Silvaro, when the young prince went by the alias of “Sesto Sciortini”.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any attacker.

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord belts out orders and can be heard even across a battlefield smothered in the grim noise of war.
The Goddess of War has blessed this one for his combat prowess.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

skillTree.localised_description: From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.

Lorenzo reveres the architecture of the ancient Reman Empire, decreeing that all buildings within his demesne are built in the Reman style. In pursuit of his dreams, he has hired famous Miragliani architects to oversee the renovation of the lands to his Reman vision.

effects.description:
Construction cost: -15% for all buildings
	(local province)

Construction time: -30% for all buildings
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Lorenzo is very proud of his lineage, which traces back to Luccini's founders, the skilled warrior Lucan and the great sorceress Luccina. The city, founded on an old, ruin-strewn acropolis, has been a paragon of stability amongst the lands of Tilea thanks to the populist image of its ruling dynasty.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations : +10 with the Southern Realms
Diplomatic relations: +5 with the nations of Men
Diplomatic relations : +15 with the Southern Realms
Diplomatic relations: +10 with the nations of Men

skillTree.localised_description: I believe I was perfectly clear. The tax rates are whatever I tell you they are. If you think we take too much, you can take up a pike and serve. Where is the confusion in that?
Lorenzo is a firm believer that every man in Luccini's army should be ready to fight hand-to-hand if the circumstances require.

effects.description:
Charge Bonus: +5 for all artillery
	(Lord's army)

Melee Attack: +4 for Tanks and Artillery Crews
	(Lord's army)

Charge Bonus: +15 for all artillery
	(Lord's army)

Melee Attack: +8 for Tanks and Artillery Crews
	(Lord's army)

Charge Bonus: +35 for all artillery
	(Lord's army)

Melee Attack: +12 for Tanks and Artillery Crews
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Lorenzo will loot and pillage anyone and anyplace with even a single piece of gold to offer, no matter who they answer to; as long as money flows into the coffers, he is content.

Lorenzo follows many of the ancient classical Tilean athletic pursuits that his ancestors of Luccini practiced, and as a result he is a very well-built, muscular man, similar in appearance to a bronze statue of Lucan. He regularly rows across the Tilean Sea, wrestles the mightiest opponents or runs from one end of his principality to the other.

related_attributes.bullet_text: Even when performing the most fatiguing actions, this unit never loses vigour.

skillTree.localised_description: Lorenzo always takes his place at the front ranks of his pikemen or leads his soldiers on board his Man-O-War. This is very inspiring to his troops, and they are eager to fight for and defend their prince.

Many in Lorenzo’s army adopt the strict regimen of ancient Remans much like their leader. As a result, even those who are scrawny and abdominous become robust and muscular during their time under Lorenzo’s banner.
Though Lorenzo’s rise to power as Prince of Luccini was chaotic and contentious, his right to rule has now been solidified with little to no opposition remaining.

effects.description:
Leadership: +10 when fighting against Humans
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Although Lorenzo is proficient at the use of both a firearm and a blade, prioritising frontline combat will improve the morale of his men and strike fear into the hearts of his enemies.
Lorenzo's father personally trained him in swordplay from a very young age, honing not just his swordsmanship but also his agility and wit, making him a formidable foe in close combat.

Lorenzo has been to many distant lands in his younger days and built quite a reputation for himself. Stories are told of him facing off against giant lizards in Lustria, slaughtering bands of Tigermen along the coasts of Kosala, and fending off a Grey Kraken during a naval blockade of Sartosa.
If a king doesn't lead, how can he expect his subordinates to follow?
A master of the sword, Lorenzo can best even the greatest duellists of the Empire.
Though Lorenzo is an incredibly competent front-line combatant, he won’t pass up the opportunity to pick off his enemies before engaging in melee.
Carrying more ammunition can never hurt.
The guns in Lorenzo's army are designed by the famous Leonardo da Miragliano, as a gift from the Prince of Miragliano. The new designs allow the weapons to hit harder and reload faster.
As waves of raiders and pirates landed over the years, the Luccinian generals had to adapt ambush tactics to compensate for their lack of numbers.

effects.description:
Armour-piercing weapon damage: +3 during ambushes
	(Lord's army)

Armour-piercing weapon damage: +6 during ambushes
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Lorenzo has modified the Sciortini to Leonardo's specifications, decreasing reload time and extending its range..

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit remains hidden while firing.

effects.description: "Explosive Bullets" ammunition (projectiles will cause explosive damage)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit remains hidden while firing.

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: “We march to war for our Prince, and the two-headed Leopard.”

skillTree.localised_description: Honest Tilea-forged steel is all a soldier could ask when confronting the myriad foes in battle.

skillTree.localised_description: Lorenzo has destroyed thousands upon thousands of troops with his devastating barrages. His artillery tactics are considered some of the greatest in the Old World, though the Dwarves disagree.

Missile strength: +6% for Artillery units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +9% for Artillery units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The frontline will either make or break you. Those who survive become the backbone of any army.

skillTree.localised_description: Some men grow to relish war, dulled to the pain and living solely for the thrill of the kill.

skillTree.localised_description: Those in command of ordnance can potentially decide a battle before the melee has even begun.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Revered by the masses, such a celebrated leader will inspire many new recruits.
The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.
It is said that Sigmar would bear a mortal wound and carry on fighting; this champion follows the hallowed Warrior-God.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +250 metres without incurring any time penalty
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +600 metres without incurring any time penalty
Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +1000 metres without incurring any time penalty

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: "Ever thought about joining the Elector's troops, chief? You'd make a good soldier alright."

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any attacker.

effects.description: Has access to a unique tech tree

Luccini's trade routes are assailed by pirates!
	(Negative province effect. Luccini must invest in their tech tree to deal with this threat.)

items.colour_text: Lorenzo Lupo's sword, believed to be the actual sword used by his remote ancestor, Lucan, the founder of Luccini. The sword's razor-sharp edge cuts through any armour with ease.

effects.description:
Magic item drop chance from battle: +15%
	(factionwide)

items.colour_text: Luccina, sister of Lucan, was said to be a sorceress. Lorenzo wears a ring which bears a cameo gem depicting her, and which may even have been hers. The gem has the ability of restoring the soldiers' morale, returning their will to fight for their lord again.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

effects.description: Chance of Winds of Magic changing in strength: +15%

Magic item drop chance from battle: +15%
	(factionwide)

items.colour_text: This old shield was found during the rebuilding of the Temple of Myrmidia on Luccini's acropolis. It dates to the time of the founding of the city, or perhaps even earlier. The shield bears the sun symbol of the war goddess of the south and has the magical ability to dazzle the bearer's opponents.

effects.description:
Magic item drop chance from battle: +15%
	(factionwide)

items.colour_text: Myrmidia is a Human goddess of war, and a patron of Tilea and Estalia. She rewards the most honourable warriors and inspires commanders with tactical brilliance. Those fighting under this banner are motivated to continue to endure, their blades guided by the goddess to the enemy’s hearts.

Every good leader needs a loyal right-hand man. Marco is an elegant man who has been trusted with managing and arranging contracts for Lorenzo’s mercenaries. However, he does not just allow any fools calling themselves mercenaries to join the Prince’s ranks, as he carefully vets every gang before they are sent to Lorenzo.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Lorenzo Lupo is the current reigning Prince of the city-state of Luccini and claims descent from the city's divine founders, Lucan and Luccina.
